metadata.author: Harry Potter
metadata.content: Suryakumar Yadav recalls Mumbai Indians debut: Barely slept the night beforeIPL 2025: Suryakumar Yadav recalled his IPL debut for the Mumbai Indians back in 2012 against Pune Warriors. The right-handed batter recently completed 4000 runs in the IPL.Listen to StoryLive TVShareSuryakumar Yadav made his MI debut back in 2012. Courtesy: APIndia Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 15:10 ISTIn ShortSuryakumar Yadav made his IPL debut back in 2012Suryakumar had scored a 4-ball duckSuryakumar recently completed 4000 IPL runsSuryakumar Yadav went down the memory lane and recalled his debut in the Indian Premier League (IPL). Back in 2012, Suryakumar stepped out for Mumbai Indians (MI) against the now-defunct Pune Warriors at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai.Suryakumar didn’t have a memorable outing after Marlon Samuels dismissed him for a four-ball duck. MI lost the match by 28 runs after struggling to 101 for nine while chasing 130. Yadav said that he couldn't sleep the night before debuting for MI."I barely slept the night before my debut for Mumbai Indians — went to bed around 4 or 5 in the morning. There was so much excitement. Playing for a franchise brings a different kind of buzz. I was just enjoying the moment, thinking about stepping onto the field for warm-up and as soon as I did, I was already sweating. It felt really good,” Suryakumar said.‘Enjoy the game’After making his IPL debut, Suryakumar had to grind hard in the IPL and domestic cricket before making his international debut in 2021."You keep working hard and wait for your chance, but it's natural to wonder — when will it come? When it finally does, if you put too much pressure on yourself, it doesn’t help. I’ve learned to just enjoy the game, stay true to myself, and go back to work if things don’t click. That mindset came from years of playing domestic cricket,” Suryakumar added.Suryakumar also became the World No.1 in T20Is, showing his effectiveness in the 20-over format of the game. In 83 T20Is thus far, Suryakumar has scored 2598 runs at an average of 38.20 with four centuries and 21 half-centuries.Recently,Suryakumar also completed 4000 runs in the IPL. In the ongoing IPL edition, Suryakumar has scored 427 runs from 10 games at an average of 61 and a strike-rate of 169.44.Stay updated onIPL 2025with India Today! Don't miss a moment!- EndsPublished
metadata.title: Suryakumar Yadav recalls Mumbai Indians debut: Barely slept the night before

metadata.content: Pickleball lands in administrative war as AIPA opposes government recognition of IPAThe All India Pickleball Association (AIPA) has opposed the Sports Ministry's decision to grant National Sports Federation (NSF) status to the Indian Pickleball Association (IPA), calling the move unjustified in a letter dated April 25, 2025.Listen to StoryLive TVSharePickleball lands in administrative war as AIPA opposes government recognition of IPA (India Today Photo)Press Trust of IndiaNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 14:27 ISTIn ShortPickleball combines elements of tennis, table tennis and badmintonSports Ministry granted national federation status to the recently formed IPAThe AIPA issued a statement questioning the Sports Ministry's moveJust about finding its space in India right now, pickleball is already embroiled in an administrative turf war after the Sports Ministry granted national federation status to the recently formed Indian Pickleball Association (IPA), prompting the much older All India Pickleball Association (AIPA) to raise objections and threaten legal action.The decision to grant recognition to IPA was taken on April 25, making it eligible for financial grants and autonomy to regulate, promote and develop the sport nationally."The IPA has been recognised by the ministry after a representation by the body a few days ago," a sports ministry official told PTI.Pickleball, which has its origins in the USA, combines elements of tennis, table tennis and badminton. It is played in both singles and doubles format using a paddle and a perforated hollow plastic ball volleyed across a court that is the same size as a doubles' badminton court with a slightly low-placed net."This is a defining moment, but we see it as just the beginning. Our focus is firmly on the future, building a pipeline of talent, creating career opportunities, and ensuring every Indian has access to the joy and benefits of pickleball," IPA President Suryaveer Singh Bhullar posted on Instagram.AIPA QUESTIONS GOVERNMENT 'S DECISIONThe AIPA issued a statement questioning the ministry's move, claiming it to be the "pioneering body responsible for introducing and nurturing Pickleball in India since 2007–08.""This decision is not only disheartening but raises serious concerns regarding transparency and fairness in sports governance. In the interest of fair play and sportsmanship, we urge the Ministry to reconsider its decision and uphold the values of clean sports," AIPA President Arvind Prabhoo stated.The AIPA cited a clause in the 2011 National Sports Code which mandates that for a body to be considered a National Sports Federation, it should have "actively existed for more than three years on the date of application for recognition."The IPA was registered in November last year as per the records of the Registrar of Companies, while the AIPA had completed this formality back in 2008.The AIPA statement alleged that the Ministry's move appears to have been influenced by "undue lobbying and misleading representations made by the newly formed entity.""The AIPA gave a representation to the Sports Ministry on October 18 last year. But the Ministry has decided to grant recognition to a four-month old company that has no organisational set-up, no district level presence like us," AIPA Treasurer Nikhil Mathare told PTI."Given the exemptions that have been made for AIPA, we are left with no choice but to take legal recourse. But we will have a conversation with the ministry before we proceed with it," he added.Pickleball's global administration has also witnessed a fair number of tug of wars over the years. There are three bodies that claim to be global governing bodies of the sport.The International Pickleball Federation (IPF), the World Pickleball Federation (WPF) and the Global Pickleball Federation (GPF). The IPF came into existence in 2010, followed by the WPF in 2018, while the GPF was founded in 2023 after the USA broke ranks with the IPF- EndsPublished
metadata.title: Pickleball lands in administrative war as AIPA opposes government recognition of IPA

metadata.author: Mary Poppins
metadata.content: Shikhar Dhawan confirms relationship with girlfriend Sophie Shine in Insta postFormer India cricketer Shikhar Dhawan and his girlfriend, Sophie Shine, confirmed their relationship with an Instagram post on Thursday, 1 May. The couple were previously spotted together during the Champions Trophy in Dubai.Listen to StoryLive TVShareShikhar Dhawan and Sophie Shine (Sophie Shine/instagram)India Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 19:24 ISTIn ShortShikhar Dhawan reportedly met Sophie Shine in the UAEShikhar and Sophie made their relationship official with a social media postThe couple was previously seen together during a Champions Trophy matchFormer India cricketer Shikhar Dhawan has made his relationship official on social media, sharing a post with his girlfriend on Thursday, 1 May. Dhawan's partner, Sophie Shine, posted a photo of the two together, which has since gone viral.Sophie captioned the photo, "My love," accompanied by a heart emoji. This marks the first time Sophie and Dhawan have gone public with their relationship, putting an end to months of swirling rumours.Shikhar and Sophie were previously spotted together during a Champions Trophy match in Dubai earlier in 2025. The pair also attended a media conclave, where Dhawan hinted that he had found love again.WHO IS SOPHIE SHINEAccording to her LinkedIn profile, Sophie, an Irish product consultant, serves as Second Vice President - Product Consultant at Northern Trust Corporation, an American financial services company. Dhawan and Sophie reportedly met in the UAE, where Sophie resides.She holds a degree in Marketing and Management from the Limerick Institute of Technology and previously studied at Castleroy College in Ireland.View this post on InstagramA post shared by Soph all but confirmed his relationship with Sophie during the media conclave, adding that he had moved on from his previous relationship."I will not take any names. But the most beautiful girl in the room is my girlfriend. Now you can figure it out," he told the anchor when asked to name his partner at the Times Now Conclave.Notably, in February 2025, Dhawan spoke candidly about his struggles following his divorce,revealing that it had been two years since he last saw his son, Zoravar,and over a year since they last spoke.Dhawan and his estranged wife, Aesha Mukherjee, divorced in October 2023 after 11 years of marriage. The cricketer married Aesha, who has two daughters from a previous marriage, in 2011, but their relationship ended after several difficult years.A Delhi court that granted Dhawan's divorce noted that he had endured mental distress due to his ex-wife, who had kept him separated from his only son for years. The court stated that Aesha either did not contest these allegations or failed to defend herself.Despite this, Dhawan was unable to secure permanent custody of Zoravar. The court granted him visitation rights and permitted video calls for a 'reasonable period' in both India and Australia, where his estranged wife resides. However, Dhawan has claimed he was blocked from all virtual communication with his son.- EndsPublished
metadata.title: Shikhar Dhawan confirms relationship with girlfriend Sophie Shine in Insta post

metadata.author: Harry Potter
metadata.content: Virender Sehwag reveals why Delhi didn't pick Virat Kohli in IPL 2008Former India cricketer and Delhi Daredevils (now Delhi Capitals) captain Virender Sehwag has revealed the real reason why Delhi didn't choose Virat Kohli in the Under-19 player's draft of the Indian Premier League 2008 (IPL 2008).Listen to StoryLive TVShareVirat Kohli IPL 2011 (Photo by MANAN VATSYAYANA / AFP)India Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 17:58 ISTIn ShortDelhi picked Pradeep Sangwan in under 19 players' draftThe left-arm seamer played for three seasons for DelhiVirat KOhli was picked up RCB in the under 19 draftFormer India cricketer Virender Sehwag has opened up on why Delhi Daredevils (now Delhi Capitals) didn’t choose Virat Kohli from the Under-19 players draft ahead of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2008. The players from India’s Under-19 World Cup-winning squad were put in a draft, and all eight teams had to choose the players one by one.Delhi ended up picking left-arm seamer Pradeep Sangwaninstead of the Under-19 captain Virat Kohli, a move which is seen as the biggest missed opportunity in the history of IPL. Recently, Sehwag explained the reasoning behind the move and revealed that since Delhi was full of several batters, they needed a bowler and hence ended up choosing Pradeep Sangwan."I was the captain who didn’t pick Virat Kohli, and chose Pradeep Sangwan. He wasn’t even on the auction table. We already had — I was there, Gautam Gambhir, Shikhar Dhawan, Dilshan — we had so many top-order openers. Then there was AB de Villiers too. So we already had a lot of batsmen, but we didn’t have bowlers. Our thinking was, let’s pick a bowler, and a left-arm one to bring some variety. So maybe that was a good choice — Mahesh and Pradeep Sangwan, these were two young bowlers at the time. In the first three years we played, both of them did well for us,” Sehwag said on Cricbuzz.Sangwan had a quiet season in 2008 as he ended up picking five wickets in the seven innings. However, he made a strong comeback in the next season ashe scalped 15 wickets from 13 innings in Delhi’s run to the semi-final.Sangwan played for three seasons in Delhi and scalped 29 wickets.On the other hand, Virat Kohli went on to become a legend of the game in the following years as he now holds the record for most runs scored in the history of IPL. The star batter remains the only player to play for a single team in IPL history across all seasons and is also the poster boy for the T20 extravaganza.Stay updated onIPL 2025with India Today! Don't miss a moment!- EndsPublished

metadata.content: IPL: Rohit Sharma completes 6,000 runs for MI, joins Virat Kohli in unique listRR vs MI: Rohit Sharma has become the second batter to score over 6,000 runs for a single IPL franchise. His resurgence in form has significantly contributed to Mumbai Indians' resurgent run in IPL 2025.Listen to StoryLive TVShareRohit Sharma smashed a 36-ball 53 for MI in Jaipur on May 1 (PTI Photo)India Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 21:13 ISTIn ShortRohit Sharma completes 6,000 runs for Mumbai Indians in T20sRohit scored a 36-ball 53 for MI against Rajasthan RoyalsRohit has hit three fifties in his last four innings in the IPLIndia captain Rohit Sharma has become only the second batter in the history of Twenty20 cricket to score more than 6,000 runs for an Indian Premier League (IPL) team. Rohit reached the milestone when he struck a fifty for Mumbai Indians against Rajasthan Royals at the Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur on Thursday, 1 May.Rohit Sharma joins Virat Kohli as only the second batter to score 6,000 runs for a single IPL franchise. Rohit has amassed 5,751 runs in the IPL for Mumbai Indians and 6,024 overall for the five-time champions, including his runs in the now-defunct Champions League T20. Kohli tops the list, having scored 8,477 runs for Royal Challengers Bengaluru, remaining the only player to have represented the same franchise throughout his 18-year IPL career. |RR vs MI Scorecard|MOST RUNS FOR AN IPL FRANCHISEVirat Kohli - 8,447 runs in 262 matchesRohit Sharma - 6,024 runs in 231 matchesSuresh Raina - 5,529 runs in 200 matchesMS Dhoni - 5,269 runs in 268 matchesRohit Sharma, 37, has been in fine form in IPL 2025, having overcome a sluggish start to the season. The veteran batter failed to go past the 30-run mark in his first six matches but has since struck three fifty-plus scores in his last four outings.Rohit produced a well-paced 53 off 36 balls for Mumbai Indians against Rajasthan Royals, adding 116 runs for the opening partnership with Ryan Rickelton, who smashed 61 off just 38 deliveries.Rohit took his time in the initial four overs after Rajasthan won the toss and opted to field. The seasoned campaigner assessed the conditions before switching gears, helping Mumbai Indians plunder 31 runs in the last two overs of their powerplay.Rohit struck nine boundaries, taking on spinners Maheesh Theekshana and Kumar Kartikeya with great effect, sweeping and pulling them to the fence with authority.Rohit's return to form has coincided with Mumbai Indians' resurgence in IPL 2025. MI, who had won only one of their first five matches, have surged into the top four with five consecutive victories.Stay updated onIPL 2025with India Today! Getmatch schedules,team squads,live score, and the latestIPL points tableforCSK,MI,RCB,KKR,SRH,LSG,DC,GT,PBKS, andRR. Plus, keep track of the top contenders for the IPLOrange CapandPurple Cap. Don't miss a moment!- EndsPublished
metadata.title: IPL: Rohit Sharma completes 6,000 runs for MI, joins Virat Kohli in unique list

metadata.content: RR vs MI: Sandeep Sharma misses game due to broken finger as Rajasthan make 2 changesRajasthan Royals (RR) seamer Sandeep Sharma has been ruled out of the clash against Mumbai Indians due to a broken finger. Rajasthan Royals have been forced to make two changes in the team.Listen to StoryLive TVShareSandeep Sharma (PTI Photo)India Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 19:39 ISTIn ShortRajasthan Royals won the toss and opted to bowlAkash Madhwal replaced Sandeep in the playing XIWanindu Hasaranga also got ruled out of the fixtureRajasthan Royals (RR) seamer Sandeep Sharma is set to miss the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) Match 50 against Mumbai Indians (MI) due to a broken finger. RR captain Riyan Parag gave the update on Sandeep’s fitness at the toss as he opted to bowl first after winning the toss.The right-arm seamer hasn’t had a memorable ongoing season, having scalped nine wickets from ten innings with best figures of 2/21 in four overs against Punjab Kings (PBKS). Sharma has been replaced by Akash Madhwal in the playing XI, who is set to make his debut for the Rajasthan Royals after being bought for Rs 1.20 Crore.IPL 2025: RR vs MI UpdatesThere was one more change in the RR playing XI as Wanindu Hasaranga got ruled out due to a niggle and got replaced by Kumar Kartikeya. Hasaranga is the joint highest wicket-taker for RR in the ongoing season with ten wickets from eight matches.“We'll bowl first. We might see some dew later. Usually the wicket settles down a little later at night. Want to exploit that. We've kept it very simple regardless of winning or losing. Rahul sir has made it clear, we keep it simple whether we go high or low. Three games ago, the message was we take it one game at a time. If we play to our potential, we know how good we can be. Just want to give everyone the freedom to play their game. Couple of changes, Hasaranga has a niggle, Kumar Kartikeya comes in, Sandy (Sandeep Sharma) bhai has broken his finger so Madhwal comes in,” said Parag at the toss.On the other hand, Mumbai Indians didn’t make any changes in the playing XI.Rajasthan Royals(Playing XI): Yashasvi Jaiswal, Vaibhav Suryavanshi, Nitish Rana, Riyan Parag(c), Dhruv Jurel(w), Shimron Hetmyer, Jofra Archer, Maheesh Theekshana, Kumar Kartikeya, Akash Madhwal, Fazalhaq FarooqiImpact Subs:Shubham Dubey, Tushar Deshpande, Kunal Singh Rathore, Yudhvir Singh Charak, Kwena MaphakaMumbai Indians(Playing XI): Ryan Rickelton(w), Rohit Sharma, Will Jacks, Suryakumar Yadav, Tilak Varma, Hardik Pandya(c), Naman Dhir, Corbin Bosch, Deepak Chahar, Trent Boult, Jasprit BumrahImpact Subs:Raj Bawa, Satyanarayana Raju, Robin Minz, Reece Topley, Karn SharmaStay updated onIPL 2025with India Today! Getmatch schedules,team squads,live score, and the latestIPL points tableforCSK,MI,RCB,KKR,SRH,LSG,DC,GT,PBKS, andRR. Plus, keep track of the top contenders for the IPLOrange CapandPurple Cap. Don't miss a moment!- EndsPublished

metadata.content: Shubman Gill likely to play vs SRH despite back spasm scare, confirms GT's Vikram SolankiGujarat Titans Shubman Gill is likely to play against SunRisers Hyderabad despite struggling with a back spasm, informed GT director of cricket Vikram Solanki. Gill suffered back spasm during the team's previous match vs Rajasthan Royals.Listen to StoryLive TVShareShubman Gill trains before match vs SRH. (PTI Photo)India Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 22:30 ISTIn ShortGujarat face Hyderabad in their 10th match of IPL 2025GT have performed strongly this seasonGill suffered a back spasm vs RRGujarat Titans captain Shubman Gill is likely to play against SunRisers Hyderabad despite suffering a back issue in the last game. Gill could not field against Rajasthan Royals in GT's last match after suffering a back spasm on April 28, Monday.Gujarat have done well in the IPL this season and have 12 points from 9 matches. They have consistently been in the top 2 positions in the league table and would not like to lose their momentum in the final stage of the tournament.Gujarat Titans' director of cricket Vikram Solanki confirmed the issue in the pre-match press conference and said that it was a precautionary move to take Shubman off the field against Rajasthan, and that it was likely that the skipper would be taking the field against SRH.GT got hammered by Rajasthan in their previous game,with 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi taking the attack to the opposition. Vaibhav scored a 35-ball hundred, the second fastest in IPL history, to hand GT their first defeat in 3 matches.“His fitness, there was a bit of a back spasm. We’re just trying to be careful with it. He'll be at training today. We'll just see where he's at. We're reasonably confident that he's going to be OK,” said Solanki on the eve of GT’s game against SRH in Ahmedabad.Solanki insisted that Suryavanshi’s bruising 35-ball 100 has not heaped any extra pressure on his side.“Firstly, I don't think the team has been decimated or anything of the sort. We mustn't take any credit away from that young man. He played quite brilliantly,” he said.The former England batter said they could have planned better against the 14-year-old RR batter when he was on a rampage.“Of course, we could have done things differently. We could have bowled in a slightly more controlling manner, we could have sort of shut him down perhaps,” he added.GT are up against SRH, who need to win all their matches to directly qualify for the IPL playoffs. SRH remained in the hunt by stuttering to a victory against Chennai Super Kings in their previous match.“We must pay the due respect that SRH deserves. They are a very strong team. We will be conscious of the threat that they have. They've got match-winners across their team," Vikram Solanki said.SRH had taken a mini-vacation in the Maldives in their week-long break before this match. All eyes will be on SRH batters vs Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna — two pacers who have been on song this season.- EndsPublished
metadata.title: Shubman Gill likely to play vs SRH despite back spasm scare, confirms GT's Vikram Solanki

metadata.author: Harry Potter
metadata.content: Lamine Yamal deserves to win Ballon d'Or if Barcelona win Champions League: Rio FerdinandFormer Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand has said that Lamine Yamal deserves to win the Ballon d'Or if he is able to guide Barcelona to a Champions League victory. Yamal was sensational in Barca's first leg of semi-final against Inter Milan.Listen to StoryLive TVShareLamine Yamal celebrates his goal vs Inter Milan. (AP Photo)India Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 18:25 ISTIn ShortBarcelona are playing Inter Milan in semi-final of UCLBarcelona drew Inter 3-3 in the first legLamine Yamal scored an incredible goalBarcelona youngster Lamine Yamal played an incredible game on Wednesday evening in the Champions League semi-final against Inter Milan. Down 0–2, Yamal grabbed the game by the scruff of its neck and inspired Barcelona to an exceptional comeback.TheChampions League clash at the Llus Companys Olympic Stadium finished 3–3, with the hosts scoring the final goal of the match to draw level. Yamal's performance was impressive, as he not only scored a goal, but was influential in the build-up to the second one as well.Former Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand reacted to the player's brilliance and said that the 17-year-old should win the Ballon d'Or if he inspires FC Barcelona to a Champions League victory."Ballon d'Or, Ballon d'Or, Ballon d'Or. Lamine Yamal. I don’t think there is anyone more exciting to watch in a stadium now. If he is decisive in Milan and the final, I think he deserves it," Ferdinand said on his YouTube channel after the match.The match against Inter Milan was Yamal's 100th at just 17 years and 291 days. On Wednesday, Yamal became the youngest player to score in a Champions League semi-final, eclipsing the record set by Kylian Mbapp, who was 18 when he achieved the feat in 2017.Lamine Yamal. (Courtesy: Reuters)"Lamine (Yamal) showed us the way with that incredible goal because it was crucial to score that goal after we were losing by two goals. He played really well," Barcelona manager Hansi Flick told Movistar Plus."We played with style and we tried to win. Lamine was a very important player for us... In the big games, as he has already shown, he always turns up."Inter Milan manager Simone Inzaghi was also full of praise for Yamal, revealing he had to make several adjustments at halftime to try and contain the talented teenager."We had to be better on Lamine Yamal, but it's much easier to say that from outside. He is a player who impressed me and he created a lot of problems for us, mainly in the last 30 minutes of the first half," Inzaghi said."Barca are a team of fantastic players and to come here and play a game like this, against the most offensive and most beautiful team in the world, must make us proud. We could also have won it, but we were playing against a team that has a player who is difficult to mark, who created so many problems for us."He is a talent that is born every 50 years. I had never seen him live, and today he impressed me."- EndsPublished
metadata.title: Lamine Yamal deserves to win Ballon d'Or if Barcelona win Champions League: Rio Ferdinand

metadata.content: Suyash Sharma thanks RCB for life-changing hernia surgery: I used to take injectionIPL 2025: RCB leg-spinner Suyash Sharma said how the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) helped him recover from his hernia surgeries.Listen to StoryLive TVShareSuyash Sharma is playing for RCB in IPL 2025. Courtesy: PTIIndia Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 14:25 ISTIn ShortSuyash Sharma is playing for RCB in IPL 2025Suyash has 4 wickets from 9 matches in the tournamentSuyash said how he recovered from hernia surgeriesLeg-spinner Suyash Sharma thanked the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) for helping him in his hernia surgery. The leg-spinner said that he didn’t expect to feature in the first few games of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 due to his injury.After making his IPL debut in 2023, the 21-year-old Suyash stayed with the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) for two seasons before RCB picked him for Rs 2.60 crore in the mega auction that took place in Jeddah last year.Suyash, who has 14 wickets to his name from 22 IPL matches, said that he once used to play with injections."I was very happy, absolutely happy. I knew that with RCB, I had a good chance. I had been practicing — this had been going on for two years. Until two years ago, I used to play by taking injections. We didn’t know what was going on in India as we didn’t know what the issue was. Then it became a problem,” Suyash told on RCB Bold Diaries.:21-year old Suyash has been our unsung hero this#IPL!From battling pain in the body, to recovering after surgery right on time, and working hard on his fitness and variations, eager to make a strong impact - his storypic.twitter.com/bC1mt25jzW— Royal Challengers Bengaluru 1, 2025"RCB sent me to London for my surgery. And there I had James Pipey. He and his family treated me like their own family. I had three hernias, I’m telling the truth — I didn’t even expect to play the first match. I was told that I should play after three or four matches because my surgery was quite major.“But James took such good care of me, better than anyone else could. I’m really thankful that I came to this franchise — I became completely fit. Otherwise, I have been dealing with this issue for the past two years. I had gotten used to playing in pain,” Suyash added.In nine matches in IPL 2025, Suyash has picked up four wickets at an economy rate of 7.97 with best figures of 4-0-26-2 against Punjab Kings (PBKS) on April 20 at the Maharaja Yadavindra Singh International Cricket Stadium in Mullanpur.RCB are currently placed atop of the table and will next face Chennai Super Kings (CSK) at home.Stay updated onIPL 2025with India Today! metadata.content: IPL 2025: Former England football manager Gareth Southgate watches RR vs MIFormer manager of the England football team, Gareth Southgate was seen enjoying an IPL match in Jaipur. His visit coincided with Rajasthan Royals' campaign supporting women's initiatives.Listen to StoryLive TVShareGareth Southgate watches the match between RR and MI. (Star Sports Screengrab)India Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 20:35 ISTIn ShortGareth Southgate watched IPL match in Jaipur post England tenureSouthgate donned Rajasthan Royals' special pink kit during the matchRajasthan Royals' pink jersey promotes women's initiatives in RajasthanFormer England manager Gareth Southgate was seen watching the Indian Premier League in Jaipur on Thursday, 1 May. Southgate, who stepped down from his position as England manager in 2024, was seen wearing Rajasthan Royals' special pink kit.Southgate was watching Rajasthan Royals play against Mumbai Indians on May 1. The manager had his family around him as well. Southgate stepped down as the England manager after the Euro 2024 final loss vs Spain. "After 102 games and almost eight years in charge, Gareth Southgate has announced he is to leave his role as manager of England," the England football team had said via Twitter on July 16, 2024.Gareth Southgate stepped down from his positionafter almost 8 years in charge, where he reached back-to-back Euro finals and the 2018 FIFA World Cup semi-final. Speaking after the Euro loss, Southgate had confirmed that he would have a discussion with the FA about his role in the England team. Southgate had been heavily criticised for his brand of football, which was uninspiring to many.After resigning from his position as the England manager, Southgate joined the UEFA as their technical advisor. Southgate is responsible for analysing games from a coaching standpoint and creating reports using statistical and video analysis.RAJASTHAN ROYALS' PINK INITIATIVEOn Thursday, Rajasthan Royals played in their special pink jersey, through which they promote women's initiatives. The Royal Rajasthan Foundation (RRF), the CSR side of Rajasthan Royals, launched a campaign film 'Aurat Hai Toh Bharat Hai' on International Women's Day.For this match, RR contributed Rs 100 to women-led rural transformation in Rajasthan for every ticket purchase. For every six hit during the match by either team, RRF committed to providing electricity to six homes in the Sambhar region with solar power.Stay updated onIPL 2025with India Today! metadata.content: IPL 2025: Ruthless MI top table, knock Rajasthan Royals out of playoffs raceMumbai Indians (MI) continued their winning run in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) with a 100-run win over Rajasthan Royals (RR) at Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur. The victory extended their winning streak to six matches as they climbed to the top of the points table.Listen to StoryLive TVShareJasprit Bumrah, Hardik Pandya (AP Photo)Rishabh BeniwalNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 23:36 ISTIn ShortMumbai Indians scored 217/2 in 20 overs batting firstRajasthan Royals got bundled out for 117 in 16.1 oversMumbai Indians extended their winning streak to seven matchesMumbai Indians (MI) have made a roaring comeback in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) as they extended their winning streak to six matches with a 100-run victory over Rajasthan Royals (RR). The Hardik Pandya-led side played at its dominating best, crushing Rajasthan on Thursday, May 1, at Sawai Mansingh Stadium, Jaipur, to knock them out of the competition.The victory also helped MI end their 12-year winning drought in Jaipur, with their last victory at the venue coming way back in 2013. A hapless Rajasthan batting line-up could only score 117 in 16.1 overs chasing a massive target of 218, with Jofra Archer top scoring with 30 (27). Following their commanding victory, Mumbai climbed to the top of the points table with seven wins from 11 matches, having 14 points to their name.On the other hand, Rajasthan maintained eighth spot, with three wins from ten matches, having six points. It has been a remarkable comeback for Mumbai, who won just one out of the first five matches.A ruthless bowling displayDefending a massive score, the potent bowling attack of Mumbai was hungry to pounce on Rajasthan. The carnage with the ball began on just the fourth delivery as last game’s heroVaibhav Suryavanshi, got a reality check in life, getting dismissed for a two-ball duckby Deepak Chahar.Suryavanshi’s early departure had little effect on his opening partner Yashasvi Jaiswal, who hit Trent Boult for two maximums. However, it was the left-arm seamer who had the last laugh by dismantling his stumps on 13 (6).IPL 2025: RR vs MI UpdatesWith both openers back in the pavilion, captain Riyan Parag walked to the crease and played a few shots to keep the required run rate in check. However, there was no stopping Trent Boult (3/28), who further got Nitish Rana holed out to deep square leg as the RR batter couldn’t make the most of his drop catch in the previous over.After Rana’s dismissal, Rajasthan were reduced to 41/3 in four overs, but their worst was yet to come as MI skipper unleashed a hungry Jasprit Bumrah (2/15) on them. The speedster immediately made an impact by bouncing out Parag (16 off 8) and Shimron Hetmyer (0 off 10) in his first over itself.As a result, MI became the first team this season to take five wickets inside the powerplay. There was no comeback for RR following a searing new-ball spell as Pandya (1/2) and Karn Sharma (3/23) also joined the party as Rajasthan capitulated against an all-round MI attack.Rohit, Rickelton give solid foundationThe foundation for Mumbai’s win was laid through a 116-run opening stand off 71 balls between Rohit Sharma and Ryan Rickelton, after MI were put in to bat first by RR captain Riyan Parag. The duo was circumspect against the new ball and scored their first boundary on the tenth ball of the innings as Rohit Sharma broke the shackles.At the other end, Ryan Rickelton also got a move on by targeting Fazalhaq Farooqui and Jofra Archer. The duo brought up their fifty-run stand off 32 balls and finished the powerplay on 58/0. Rickelton brought up his half century off 29 balls with a massive six against Kumar Kartikeya.At the other end,Rohit also brought up his third half-century of the season off 31 ballsas the duo registered their maiden century partnership off 61 balls. Rajasthan finally managed to break a massive partnership as Rickelton (61 off 38) and Rohit Sharma (53 off 36) got dismissed in successive overs, falling prey to Maheesh Theekshana (1/47) and Riyan Parag (1/12) respectively.Hardik, Suryakumar's fiery finishLittle did RR know, there was more misery waiting for them as Hardik Pandya and Suryakumar Yadav got together at the crease. Suryakumar made his intentions clear as he got off the mark with a boundary. Pandya also didn’t take much time to get into the groove as he also got off the mark with a cracking four against Farooqui.With a belter of a track to bat on, the duo unleashed their beast mode on RR in no time and didn’t even spare Archer. Suryakumar (48* off 23) put his 360-degree strokeplay on display, sending the ball to all corners of the ground. On the other hand, Pandya (48* off 23) continued to send the ball towards the boundary with his brute force. The duo forged an unbeaten 94-run stand off just 44 balls, giving a strong finish to Mumbai’s innings.Meanwhile, being at the top of their form, MI will next take on the high-flying Gujarat Titans (GT) on May 6 at Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. On the other hand, Rajasthan will look to salvage some pride in their remaining matches as they lock horns with Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) on May 4 at Eden Gardens in Kolkata.Stay updated onIPL 2025with India Today! Don't miss a moment!- EndsPublished
metadata.title: IPL 2025: Ruthless MI top table, knock Rajasthan Royals out of playoffs race

metadata.author: Jane Doe
metadata.content: IPL: Rohit Sharma completes 6,000 runs for MI, joins Virat Kohli in unique listRR vs MI: Rohit Sharma has become the second batter to score over 6,000 runs for a single IPL franchise. His resurgence in form has significantly contributed to Mumbai Indians' resurgent run in IPL 2025.Listen to StoryLive TVShareRohit Sharma smashed a 36-ball 53 for MI in Jaipur on May 1 (PTI Photo)India Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 21:13 ISTIn ShortRohit Sharma completes 6,000 runs for Mumbai Indians in T20sRohit scored a 36-ball 53 for MI against Rajasthan RoyalsRohit has hit three fifties in his last four innings in the IPLIndia captain Rohit Sharma has become only the second batter in the history of Twenty20 cricket to score more than 6,000 runs for an Indian Premier League (IPL) team. Rohit reached the milestone when he struck a fifty for Mumbai Indians against Rajasthan Royals at the Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur on Thursday, 1 May.Rohit Sharma joins Virat Kohli as only the second batter to score 6,000 runs for a single IPL franchise. Rohit has amassed 5,751 runs in the IPL for Mumbai Indians and 6,024 overall for the five-time champions, including his runs in the now-defunct Champions League T20. Kohli tops the list, having scored 8,477 runs for Royal Challengers Bengaluru, remaining the only player to have represented the same franchise throughout his 18-year IPL career. |RR vs MI Scorecard|MOST RUNS FOR AN IPL FRANCHISEVirat Kohli - 8,447 runs in 262 matchesRohit Sharma - 6,024 runs in 231 matchesSuresh Raina - 5,529 runs in 200 matchesMS Dhoni - 5,269 runs in 268 matchesRohit Sharma, 37, has been in fine form in IPL 2025, having overcome a sluggish start to the season. The veteran batter failed to go past the 30-run mark in his first six matches but has since struck three fifty-plus scores in his last four outings.Rohit produced a well-paced 53 off 36 balls for Mumbai Indians against Rajasthan Royals, adding 116 runs for the opening partnership with Ryan Rickelton, who smashed 61 off just 38 deliveries.Rohit took his time in the initial four overs after Rajasthan won the toss and opted to field. The seasoned campaigner assessed the conditions before switching gears, helping Mumbai Indians plunder 31 runs in the last two overs of their powerplay.Rohit struck nine boundaries, taking on spinners Maheesh Theekshana and Kumar Kartikeya with great effect, sweeping and pulling them to the fence with authority.Rohit's return to form has coincided with Mumbai Indians' resurgence in IPL 2025. MI, who had won only one of their first five matches, have surged into the top four with five consecutive victories.Stay updated onIPL 2025with India Today! Don't miss a moment!- EndsPublished

metadata.author: Akainu
metadata.content: Suyash Sharma thanks RCB for life-changing hernia surgery: I used to take injectionIPL 2025: RCB leg-spinner Suyash Sharma said how the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) helped him recover from his hernia surgeries.Listen to StoryLive TVShareSuyash Sharma is playing for RCB in IPL 2025. Courtesy: PTIIndia Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 14:25 ISTIn ShortSuyash Sharma is playing for RCB in IPL 2025Suyash has 4 wickets from 9 matches in the tournamentSuyash said how he recovered from hernia surgeriesLeg-spinner Suyash Sharma thanked the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) for helping him in his hernia surgery. The leg-spinner said that he didn’t expect to feature in the first few games of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 due to his injury.After making his IPL debut in 2023, the 21-year-old Suyash stayed with the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) for two seasons before RCB picked him for Rs 2.60 crore in the mega auction that took place in Jeddah last year.Suyash, who has 14 wickets to his name from 22 IPL matches, said that he once used to play with injections."I was very happy, absolutely happy. I knew that with RCB, I had a good chance. I had been practicing — this had been going on for two years. Until two years ago, I used to play by taking injections. We didn’t know what was going on in India as we didn’t know what the issue was. Then it became a problem,” Suyash told on RCB Bold Diaries.:21-year old Suyash has been our unsung hero this#IPL!From battling pain in the body, to recovering after surgery right on time, and working hard on his fitness and variations, eager to make a strong impact - his storypic.twitter.com/bC1mt25jzW— Royal Challengers Bengaluru 1, 2025"RCB sent me to London for my surgery. And there I had James Pipey. He and his family treated me like their own family. I had three hernias, I’m telling the truth — I didn’t even expect to play the first match. I was told that I should play after three or four matches because my surgery was quite major.“But James took such good care of me, better than anyone else could. I’m really thankful that I came to this franchise — I became completely fit. Otherwise, I have been dealing with this issue for the past two years. I had gotten used to playing in pain,” Suyash added.In nine matches in IPL 2025, Suyash has picked up four wickets at an economy rate of 7.97 with best figures of 4-0-26-2 against Punjab Kings (PBKS) on April 20 at the Maharaja Yadavindra Singh International Cricket Stadium in Mullanpur.RCB are currently placed atop of the table and will next face Chennai Super Kings (CSK) at home.Stay updated onIPL 2025with India Today! Don't miss a moment!Published

metadata.author: Harry Potter
metadata.content: Suryakumar Yadav recalls Mumbai Indians debut: Barely slept the night beforeIPL 2025: Suryakumar Yadav recalled his IPL debut for the Mumbai Indians back in 2012 against Pune Warriors. The right-handed batter recently completed 4000 runs in the IPL.Listen to StoryLive TVShareSuryakumar Yadav made his MI debut back in 2012. Courtesy: APIndia Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 15:10 ISTIn ShortSuryakumar Yadav made his IPL debut back in 2012Suryakumar had scored a 4-ball duckSuryakumar recently completed 4000 IPL runsSuryakumar Yadav went down the memory lane and recalled his debut in the Indian Premier League (IPL). Back in 2012, Suryakumar stepped out for Mumbai Indians (MI) against the now-defunct Pune Warriors at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai.Suryakumar didn’t have a memorable outing after Marlon Samuels dismissed him for a four-ball duck. MI lost the match by 28 runs after struggling to 101 for nine while chasing 130. Yadav said that he couldn't sleep the night before debuting for MI."I barely slept the night before my debut for Mumbai Indians — went to bed around 4 or 5 in the morning. There was so much excitement. Playing for a franchise brings a different kind of buzz. I was just enjoying the moment, thinking about stepping onto the field for warm-up and as soon as I did, I was already sweating. It felt really good,” Suryakumar said.‘Enjoy the game’After making his IPL debut, Suryakumar had to grind hard in the IPL and domestic cricket before making his international debut in 2021."You keep working hard and wait for your chance, but it's natural to wonder — when will it come? When it finally does, if you put too much pressure on yourself, it doesn’t help. I’ve learned to just enjoy the game, stay true to myself, and go back to work if things don’t click. That mindset came from years of playing domestic cricket,” Suryakumar added.Suryakumar also became the World No.1 in T20Is, showing his effectiveness in the 20-over format of the game. In 83 T20Is thus far, Suryakumar has scored 2598 runs at an average of 38.20 with four centuries and 21 half-centuries.Recently,Suryakumar also completed 4000 runs in the IPL. In the ongoing IPL edition, Suryakumar has scored 427 runs from 10 games at an average of 61 and a strike-rate of 169.44.Stay updated onIPL 2025with India Today! metadata.author: Harry Potter
metadata.content: Virender Sehwag reveals why Delhi didn't pick Virat Kohli in IPL 2008Former India cricketer and Delhi Daredevils (now Delhi Capitals) captain Virender Sehwag has revealed the real reason why Delhi didn't choose Virat Kohli in the Under-19 player's draft of the Indian Premier League 2008 (IPL 2008).Listen to StoryLive TVShareVirat Kohli IPL 2011 (Photo by MANAN VATSYAYANA / AFP)India Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 17:58 ISTIn ShortDelhi picked Pradeep Sangwan in under 19 players' draftThe left-arm seamer played for three seasons for DelhiVirat KOhli was picked up RCB in the under 19 draftFormer India cricketer Virender Sehwag has opened up on why Delhi Daredevils (now Delhi Capitals) didn’t choose Virat Kohli from the Under-19 players draft ahead of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2008. The players from India’s Under-19 World Cup-winning squad were put in a draft, and all eight teams had to choose the players one by one.Delhi ended up picking left-arm seamer Pradeep Sangwaninstead of the Under-19 captain Virat Kohli, a move which is seen as the biggest missed opportunity in the history of IPL. Recently, Sehwag explained the reasoning behind the move and revealed that since Delhi was full of several batters, they needed a bowler and hence ended up choosing Pradeep Sangwan."I was the captain who didn’t pick Virat Kohli, and chose Pradeep Sangwan. He wasn’t even on the auction table. We already had — I was there, Gautam Gambhir, Shikhar Dhawan, Dilshan — we had so many top-order openers. Then there was AB de Villiers too. So we already had a lot of batsmen, but we didn’t have bowlers. Our thinking was, let’s pick a bowler, and a left-arm one to bring some variety. So maybe that was a good choice — Mahesh and Pradeep Sangwan, these were two young bowlers at the time. In the first three years we played, both of them did well for us,” Sehwag said on Cricbuzz.Sangwan had a quiet season in 2008 as he ended up picking five wickets in the seven innings. However, he made a strong comeback in the next season ashe scalped 15 wickets from 13 innings in Delhi’s run to the semi-final.Sangwan played for three seasons in Delhi and scalped 29 wickets.On the other hand, Virat Kohli went on to become a legend of the game in the following years as he now holds the record for most runs scored in the history of IPL. The star batter remains the only player to play for a single team in IPL history across all seasons and is also the poster boy for the T20 extravaganza.Stay updated onIPL 2025with India Today! Don't miss a moment!- EndsPublished

metadata.content: RR vs MI: Rohit Sharma heaves sigh of relief as last-second DRS call helps him surviveMumbai Indians opening batter Rohit Sharma heaved a sigh of relief after a DRS call helped him survive against the Rajasthan Royals (RR) in match 50 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).Listen to StoryLive TVShareRyan Rickelton and Rohit Sharma (AP Photo)India Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 20:48 ISTIn ShortRohit took the review at the very last secondRohit Sharma found form against Chennai Super KingsHe started the season with a three-ball duckMumbai Indians (MI) opening batter Rohit Sharma was relieved after a reluctant DRS (Decision Review System) helped him survive against Rajasthan Royals (RR) in Match 50 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025). The incident took place in the second over of the innings as Fazalhaq Farooqi trapped him in front of the stumps.The MI opener was given out on the field, and was reluctant to go for DRS. However, he decided to get the decision reviewed by the third umpire at the very last second. Much to his good fortune, the ball pitched outside the leg stump and the decision was overturned. After the decision was overturned, Rohit was seen heaving a sigh of relief as he had a big smile on his face.IPL 2025: RR vs MI UpdatesRohit used his reprieve well as he went on to score his third half-century of the season. He reached the landmark in 31 balls despite a slow start. Rohit's innings came to an end on 53 (36) as he whacked nine fours in his innings. The opening batter tried to hit Riyan Parag down the ground but ended up getting caught at long off by Yashasvi Jaiswal.During his innings, he also completed 6000 runs for the Mumbai Indians. Earlier, Rohit found his form after starting the season on a disappointing note. He scored back-to-back match-winning knocks against Chennai Super Kings 76* (45) and Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) 70 (46), helping Mumbai extend their winning streak to five matches.- EndsPublished
metadata.title: RR vs MI: Rohit Sharma heaves sigh of relief as last-second DRS call helps him survive

metadata.author: Mary Poppins
metadata.content: RR vs MI: Sandeep Sharma misses game due to broken finger as Rajasthan make 2 changesRajasthan Royals (RR) seamer Sandeep Sharma has been ruled out of the clash against Mumbai Indians due to a broken finger. Rajasthan Royals have been forced to make two changes in the team.Listen to StoryLive TVShareSandeep Sharma (PTI Photo)India Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 19:39 ISTIn ShortRajasthan Royals won the toss and opted to bowlAkash Madhwal replaced Sandeep in the playing XIWanindu Hasaranga also got ruled out of the fixtureRajasthan Royals (RR) seamer Sandeep Sharma is set to miss the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) Match 50 against Mumbai Indians (MI) due to a broken finger. RR captain Riyan Parag gave the update on Sandeep’s fitness at the toss as he opted to bowl first after winning the toss.The right-arm seamer hasn’t had a memorable ongoing season, having scalped nine wickets from ten innings with best figures of 2/21 in four overs against Punjab Kings (PBKS). Sharma has been replaced by Akash Madhwal in the playing XI, who is set to make his debut for the Rajasthan Royals after being bought for Rs 1.20 Crore.IPL 2025: RR vs MI UpdatesThere was one more change in the RR playing XI as Wanindu Hasaranga got ruled out due to a niggle and got replaced by Kumar Kartikeya. Hasaranga is the joint highest wicket-taker for RR in the ongoing season with ten wickets from eight matches.“We'll bowl first. We might see some dew later. Usually the wicket settles down a little later at night. Want to exploit that. We've kept it very simple regardless of winning or losing. Rahul sir has made it clear, we keep it simple whether we go high or low. Three games ago, the message was we take it one game at a time. If we play to our potential, we know how good we can be. Just want to give everyone the freedom to play their game. Couple of changes, Hasaranga has a niggle, Kumar Kartikeya comes in, Sandy (Sandeep Sharma) bhai has broken his finger so Madhwal comes in,” said Parag at the toss.On the other hand, Mumbai Indians didn’t make any changes in the playing XI.Rajasthan Royals(Playing XI): Yashasvi Jaiswal, Vaibhav Suryavanshi, Nitish Rana, Riyan Parag(c), Dhruv Jurel(w), Shimron Hetmyer, Jofra Archer, Maheesh Theekshana, Kumar Kartikeya, Akash Madhwal, Fazalhaq FarooqiImpact Subs:Shubham Dubey, Tushar Deshpande, Kunal Singh Rathore, Yudhvir Singh Charak, Kwena MaphakaMumbai Indians(Playing XI): Ryan Rickelton(w), Rohit Sharma, Will Jacks, Suryakumar Yadav, Tilak Varma, Hardik Pandya(c), Naman Dhir, Corbin Bosch, Deepak Chahar, Trent Boult, Jasprit BumrahImpact Subs:Raj Bawa, Satyanarayana Raju, Robin Minz, Reece Topley, Karn SharmaStay updated onIPL 2025with India Today! metadata.author: Jane Doe
metadata.content: IPL 2025: Vaibhav Suryavanshi out for 2-ball duck days after 35-ball hundredIPL 2025, RR vs MI: Three days after he smashed the fastest hundred by an Indian in the Indian Premier League, 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryvanshi was dismissed for a duck in Rajasthan's home game against Mumbai.Listen to StoryLive TVShareVaibhav Suryavanshi was out for a two-ball duck for Rajasthan against Mumbai in Jaipur (AP Photo)India Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 22:15 ISTIn ShortVaibhav Suryavanshi was dismissed by Deepak Chahar for 0 in Jaipur on ThursdayThe 14-year-old spent a couple of seconds in the middle, struggling to deal with the disappointmentVaibhav had hit a 35-ball hundred in Jaipur as recently as MondayVaibhav Suryavanshi learnt a swift lesson: in cricket, good days and bad days come in quick succession. Just three days after becoming the youngest player in Twenty20 history to score a hundred, the 14-year-old was dismissed for a two-ball duck. Vaibhav failed to trouble the scorers in Rajasthan Royals' IPL 2025 home game against Mumbai Indians in Jaipur on Thursday, 1 May. |RR vs MI Scorecard|The teenager stood at the crease, visibly disappointed and unsure how he had failed to clear the mid-on fielder in the very first over of Rajasthan's chase of 218 at the Sawai Mansingh Stadium. The Jaipur crowd, which had roared in delight as Vaibhav took strike, fell silent as the youngster trudged back to the pavilion.Vaibhav Suryavanshi became the toast of the cricketing world when he hit 101 from just 38 balls in just his third IPL game. The 14-year-old came up with a beyond-believable big-hitting display, smashing 11 sixes and seven boundaries in Jaipur, helping Rajasthan chase 210 in just 15.5 overs.However, on Thursday, Vaibhav was not able to get under a fuller-length delivery from Deepak Chahar, who opened the bowling for Mumbai in their defence of 219. Vaibhav dug out a yorker in the first delivery he faced, but was unable to hit the next one over the mid-on fielder. MI kept the mid-on fielder inside the 30-yard circle and Will Jacks made no mistake, catching the ball and sending the young man back.Vaibhav spent a couple of seconds in the middle, unable to process the disappointment before he walked back. It was the first single-digit score for Vaibhav in IPL 2025. Rajasthan head coach Rahul Dravid was as dejected as the rest of those in pink in Jaipur, seeing Vaibhav fail to trouble the scorers. Only on Wednesday,Dravid had spokenabout the need for Vaibhav to handle the highs and lows of cricket without letting emotions take control in his teenage days.Vaibhav also became the sixth batter in IPL history to get out for a duck in the innings that followed a hundred.BATTERS WITH DUCKS AFTER HUNDRED IN IPLYusuf Pathan (2010)Suresh Raina (2013)Venkatesh Iyer (2023)Marcus Stoinis (2024)Ishan Kishan (2025)Vaibhav Suryavanshi (2025)Vaibhav, 14, is a prodigiously talented cricketer from Bihar. He became the youngest man to secure an IPL contract when he was bought for Rs 1.1 crore by Rajasthan Royals in the mega auction last year when he was still 13.Vaibhav Suryavanshi made his first-class debut for Bihar in January 2024 at just 12 years and 284 days old. In his debut outing, he scored 71 off 42 balls against Baroda in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, becoming the youngest Indian to hit a List-A fifty. On the international stage, he smashed a 58-ball century against Australia in Chennai, setting the record for the fastest youth Test hundred by an Indian, and played a key role in India’s run to the ACC U19 Asia Cup final with two vital half-centuries.- EndsPublished
metadata.title: IPL 2025: Vaibhav Suryavanshi out for 2-ball duck days after 35-ball hundred

metadata.author: Jane Doe
metadata.content: Shubman Gill likely to play vs SRH despite back spasm scare, confirms GT's Vikram SolankiGujarat Titans Shubman Gill is likely to play against SunRisers Hyderabad despite struggling with a back spasm, informed GT director of cricket Vikram Solanki. Gill suffered back spasm during the team's previous match vs Rajasthan Royals.Listen to StoryLive TVShareShubman Gill trains before match vs SRH. (PTI Photo)India Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 22:30 ISTIn ShortGujarat face Hyderabad in their 10th match of IPL 2025GT have performed strongly this seasonGill suffered a back spasm vs RRGujarat Titans captain Shubman Gill is likely to play against SunRisers Hyderabad despite suffering a back issue in the last game. Gill could not field against Rajasthan Royals in GT's last match after suffering a back spasm on April 28, Monday.Gujarat have done well in the IPL this season and have 12 points from 9 matches. They have consistently been in the top 2 positions in the league table and would not like to lose their momentum in the final stage of the tournament.Gujarat Titans' director of cricket Vikram Solanki confirmed the issue in the pre-match press conference and said that it was a precautionary move to take Shubman off the field against Rajasthan, and that it was likely that the skipper would be taking the field against SRH.GT got hammered by Rajasthan in their previous game,with 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi taking the attack to the opposition. Vaibhav scored a 35-ball hundred, the second fastest in IPL history, to hand GT their first defeat in 3 matches.“His fitness, there was a bit of a back spasm. We’re just trying to be careful with it. He'll be at training today. We'll just see where he's at. We're reasonably confident that he's going to be OK,” said Solanki on the eve of GT’s game against SRH in Ahmedabad.Solanki insisted that Suryavanshi’s bruising 35-ball 100 has not heaped any extra pressure on his side.“Firstly, I don't think the team has been decimated or anything of the sort. We mustn't take any credit away from that young man. He played quite brilliantly,” he said.The former England batter said they could have planned better against the 14-year-old RR batter when he was on a rampage.“Of course, we could have done things differently. We could have bowled in a slightly more controlling manner, we could have sort of shut him down perhaps,” he added.GT are up against SRH, who need to win all their matches to directly qualify for the IPL playoffs. SRH remained in the hunt by stuttering to a victory against Chennai Super Kings in their previous match.“We must pay the due respect that SRH deserves. They are a very strong team. We will be conscious of the threat that they have. They've got match-winners across their team," Vikram Solanki said.SRH had taken a mini-vacation in the Maldives in their week-long break before this match. All eyes will be on SRH batters vs Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna — two pacers who have been on song this season.- EndsPublished
metadata.title: Shubman Gill likely to play vs SRH despite back spasm scare, confirms GT's Vikram Solanki

metadata.author: Harry Potter
metadata.content: Pickleball lands in administrative war as AIPA opposes government recognition of IPAThe All India Pickleball Association (AIPA) has opposed the Sports Ministry's decision to grant National Sports Federation (NSF) status to the Indian Pickleball Association (IPA), calling the move unjustified in a letter dated April 25, 2025.Listen to StoryLive TVSharePickleball lands in administrative war as AIPA opposes government recognition of IPA (India Today Photo)Press Trust of IndiaNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 14:27 ISTIn ShortPickleball combines elements of tennis, table tennis and badmintonSports Ministry granted national federation status to the recently formed IPAThe AIPA issued a statement questioning the Sports Ministry's moveJust about finding its space in India right now, pickleball is already embroiled in an administrative turf war after the Sports Ministry granted national federation status to the recently formed Indian Pickleball Association (IPA), prompting the much older All India Pickleball Association (AIPA) to raise objections and threaten legal action.The decision to grant recognition to IPA was taken on April 25, making it eligible for financial grants and autonomy to regulate, promote and develop the sport nationally."The IPA has been recognised by the ministry after a representation by the body a few days ago," a sports ministry official told PTI.Pickleball, which has its origins in the USA, combines elements of tennis, table tennis and badminton. It is played in both singles and doubles format using a paddle and a perforated hollow plastic ball volleyed across a court that is the same size as a doubles' badminton court with a slightly low-placed net."This is a defining moment, but we see it as just the beginning. Our focus is firmly on the future, building a pipeline of talent, creating career opportunities, and ensuring every Indian has access to the joy and benefits of pickleball," IPA President Suryaveer Singh Bhullar posted on Instagram.AIPA QUESTIONS GOVERNMENT 'S DECISIONThe AIPA issued a statement questioning the ministry's move, claiming it to be the "pioneering body responsible for introducing and nurturing Pickleball in India since 2007–08.""This decision is not only disheartening but raises serious concerns regarding transparency and fairness in sports governance. In the interest of fair play and sportsmanship, we urge the Ministry to reconsider its decision and uphold the values of clean sports," AIPA President Arvind Prabhoo stated.The AIPA cited a clause in the 2011 National Sports Code which mandates that for a body to be considered a National Sports Federation, it should have "actively existed for more than three years on the date of application for recognition."The IPA was registered in November last year as per the records of the Registrar of Companies, while the AIPA had completed this formality back in 2008.The AIPA statement alleged that the Ministry's move appears to have been influenced by "undue lobbying and misleading representations made by the newly formed entity.""The AIPA gave a representation to the Sports Ministry on October 18 last year. But the Ministry has decided to grant recognition to a four-month old company that has no organisational set-up, no district level presence like us," AIPA Treasurer Nikhil Mathare told PTI."Given the exemptions that have been made for AIPA, we are left with no choice but to take legal recourse. But we will have a conversation with the ministry before we proceed with it," he added.Pickleball's global administration has also witnessed a fair number of tug of wars over the years. There are three bodies that claim to be global governing bodies of the sport.The International Pickleball Federation (IPF), the World Pickleball Federation (WPF) and the Global Pickleball Federation (GPF). The IPF came into existence in 2010, followed by the WPF in 2018, while the GPF was founded in 2023 after the USA broke ranks with the IPF- EndsPublished
metadata.title: Pickleball lands in administrative war as AIPA opposes government recognition of IPA

metadata.content: Suyash Sharma thanks RCB for life-changing hernia surgery: I used to take injectionIPL 2025: RCB leg-spinner Suyash Sharma said how the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) helped him recover from his hernia surgeries.Listen to StoryLive TVShareSuyash Sharma is playing for RCB in IPL 2025. Courtesy: PTIIndia Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 14:25 ISTIn ShortSuyash Sharma is playing for RCB in IPL 2025Suyash has 4 wickets from 9 matches in the tournamentSuyash said how he recovered from hernia surgeriesLeg-spinner Suyash Sharma thanked the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) for helping him in his hernia surgery. The leg-spinner said that he didn’t expect to feature in the first few games of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 due to his injury.After making his IPL debut in 2023, the 21-year-old Suyash stayed with the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) for two seasons before RCB picked him for Rs 2.60 crore in the mega auction that took place in Jeddah last year.Suyash, who has 14 wickets to his name from 22 IPL matches, said that he once used to play with injections."I was very happy, absolutely happy. I knew that with RCB, I had a good chance. I had been practicing — this had been going on for two years. Until two years ago, I used to play by taking injections. We didn’t know what was going on in India as we didn’t know what the issue was. Then it became a problem,” Suyash told on RCB Bold Diaries.:21-year old Suyash has been our unsung hero this#IPL!From battling pain in the body, to recovering after surgery right on time, and working hard on his fitness and variations, eager to make a strong impact - his storypic.twitter.com/bC1mt25jzW— Royal Challengers Bengaluru 1, 2025"RCB sent me to London for my surgery. And there I had James Pipey. He and his family treated me like their own family. I had three hernias, I’m telling the truth — I didn’t even expect to play the first match. I was told that I should play after three or four matches because my surgery was quite major.“But James took such good care of me, better than anyone else could. I’m really thankful that I came to this franchise — I became completely fit. Otherwise, I have been dealing with this issue for the past two years. I had gotten used to playing in pain,” Suyash added.In nine matches in IPL 2025, Suyash has picked up four wickets at an economy rate of 7.97 with best figures of 4-0-26-2 against Punjab Kings (PBKS) on April 20 at the Maharaja Yadavindra Singh International Cricket Stadium in Mullanpur.RCB are currently placed atop of the table and will next face Chennai Super Kings (CSK) at home.Stay updated onIPL 2025with India Today! Don't miss a moment!Published

metadata.content: IPL 2025: Vaibhav Suryavanshi out for 2-ball duck days after 35-ball hundredIPL 2025, RR vs MI: Three days after he smashed the fastest hundred by an Indian in the Indian Premier League, 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryvanshi was dismissed for a duck in Rajasthan's home game against Mumbai.Listen to StoryLive TVShareVaibhav Suryavanshi was out for a two-ball duck for Rajasthan against Mumbai in Jaipur (AP Photo)India Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 22:15 ISTIn ShortVaibhav Suryavanshi was dismissed by Deepak Chahar for 0 in Jaipur on ThursdayThe 14-year-old spent a couple of seconds in the middle, struggling to deal with the disappointmentVaibhav had hit a 35-ball hundred in Jaipur as recently as MondayVaibhav Suryavanshi learnt a swift lesson: in cricket, good days and bad days come in quick succession. Just three days after becoming the youngest player in Twenty20 history to score a hundred, the 14-year-old was dismissed for a two-ball duck. Vaibhav failed to trouble the scorers in Rajasthan Royals' IPL 2025 home game against Mumbai Indians in Jaipur on Thursday, 1 May. |RR vs MI Scorecard|The teenager stood at the crease, visibly disappointed and unsure how he had failed to clear the mid-on fielder in the very first over of Rajasthan's chase of 218 at the Sawai Mansingh Stadium. The Jaipur crowd, which had roared in delight as Vaibhav took strike, fell silent as the youngster trudged back to the pavilion.Vaibhav Suryavanshi became the toast of the cricketing world when he hit 101 from just 38 balls in just his third IPL game. The 14-year-old came up with a beyond-believable big-hitting display, smashing 11 sixes and seven boundaries in Jaipur, helping Rajasthan chase 210 in just 15.5 overs.However, on Thursday, Vaibhav was not able to get under a fuller-length delivery from Deepak Chahar, who opened the bowling for Mumbai in their defence of 219. Vaibhav dug out a yorker in the first delivery he faced, but was unable to hit the next one over the mid-on fielder. MI kept the mid-on fielder inside the 30-yard circle and Will Jacks made no mistake, catching the ball and sending the young man back.Vaibhav spent a couple of seconds in the middle, unable to process the disappointment before he walked back. It was the first single-digit score for Vaibhav in IPL 2025. Rajasthan head coach Rahul Dravid was as dejected as the rest of those in pink in Jaipur, seeing Vaibhav fail to trouble the scorers. Only on Wednesday,Dravid had spokenabout the need for Vaibhav to handle the highs and lows of cricket without letting emotions take control in his teenage days.Vaibhav also became the sixth batter in IPL history to get out for a duck in the innings that followed a hundred.BATTERS WITH DUCKS AFTER HUNDRED IN IPLYusuf Pathan (2010)Suresh Raina (2013)Venkatesh Iyer (2023)Marcus Stoinis (2024)Ishan Kishan (2025)Vaibhav Suryavanshi (2025)Vaibhav, 14, is a prodigiously talented cricketer from Bihar. He became the youngest man to secure an IPL contract when he was bought for Rs 1.1 crore by Rajasthan Royals in the mega auction last year when he was still 13.Vaibhav Suryavanshi made his first-class debut for Bihar in January 2024 at just 12 years and 284 days old. In his debut outing, he scored 71 off 42 balls against Baroda in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, becoming the youngest Indian to hit a List-A fifty. On the international stage, he smashed a 58-ball century against Australia in Chennai, setting the record for the fastest youth Test hundred by an Indian, and played a key role in India’s run to the ACC U19 Asia Cup final with two vital half-centuries.- EndsPublished
metadata.title: IPL 2025: Vaibhav Suryavanshi out for 2-ball duck days after 35-ball hundred

metadata.author: Harry Potter
metadata.content: Najmul Shanto not happy despite Chattogram win: Bangladesh should have won the seriesBangladesh skipper Najmul Hossain Shanto said that the Tigers should have won the Test series against Zimbabwe. Shanto's Tigers beat the visitors by an innings and 106 runs in Chattogram.Listen to StoryLive TVShareBangladesh drew their home Test series vs Zimbabwe. Courtesy: Bangladesh CricketIndia Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 16:09 ISTIn ShortBangladesh won the Chattogram Test by an innings and 104 runsBangladesh finished the Test series at 1-1Bangladesh had lost the Sylhet Test by 3 wicketsNajmul Hossain Shanto wasn’t a happy man despite Bangladesh’s massive win in the second Test against Craig Ervine’s Zimbabwe. On Wednesday, April 30, the Tigers hammered the visitors by an innings and 106 runs at the Bir Sreshtho Flight Lieutenant Matiur Rahman Stadium in Chattogram.Mehidy Hasan Miraz picked up a five-wicket and also scored 104 as Bangladesh finished the two-match series 1-1. Shadman Islam and Taijul Islam also scored a hundred and took a six-wicket haul respectively. But Shanto said that the home team missed out on a golden chance of winning the series."I'm not really happy. If you look at the whole series, we should have played better cricket. We didn't perform well in the first Test. Although we made a comeback, this is a series we should have won,” Shanto told the reporters after the match.Bangladesh lost the opening Test in Sylhet by three wicketsin Sylhet before making a comeback in Chattogram. Shanto said that his team’s batters need to learn how to convert starts into big scores."We played poor cricket in the first Test so it was important to bounce back. We won in Pakistan and the West Indies earlier and that means we have that ability. We just need to play according to our potential,” Shanto said."As a captain, I don't want this kind of scoreboard. If Shadman could score 200, I could hit a 100, or Mushfiqur Rahim scored 150, I would be happier, rather than everyone scoring 40s. Losing a wicket after getting set is not a good sign, as this can't enhance our confidence. In Sri Lanka, whoever gets set, should score 150-200," Shanto added.Shanto had a decent series with the bat in hand after he scored 123 runs from three innings at an average of 41 with a top score of 60.- EndsPublished
metadata.title: Najmul Shanto not happy despite Chattogram win: Bangladesh should have won the series

metadata.content: IPL: Rohit Sharma completes 6,000 runs for MI, joins Virat Kohli in unique listRR vs MI: Rohit Sharma has become the second batter to score over 6,000 runs for a single IPL franchise. His resurgence in form has significantly contributed to Mumbai Indians' resurgent run in IPL 2025.Listen to StoryLive TVShareRohit Sharma smashed a 36-ball 53 for MI in Jaipur on May 1 (PTI Photo)India Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 21:13 ISTIn ShortRohit Sharma completes 6,000 runs for Mumbai Indians in T20sRohit scored a 36-ball 53 for MI against Rajasthan RoyalsRohit has hit three fifties in his last four innings in the IPLIndia captain Rohit Sharma has become only the second batter in the history of Twenty20 cricket to score more than 6,000 runs for an Indian Premier League (IPL) team. Rohit reached the milestone when he struck a fifty for Mumbai Indians against Rajasthan Royals at the Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur on Thursday, 1 May.Rohit Sharma joins Virat Kohli as only the second batter to score 6,000 runs for a single IPL franchise. Rohit has amassed 5,751 runs in the IPL for Mumbai Indians and 6,024 overall for the five-time champions, including his runs in the now-defunct Champions League T20. Kohli tops the list, having scored 8,477 runs for Royal Challengers Bengaluru, remaining the only player to have represented the same franchise throughout his 18-year IPL career. |RR vs MI Scorecard|MOST RUNS FOR AN IPL FRANCHISEVirat Kohli - 8,447 runs in 262 matchesRohit Sharma - 6,024 runs in 231 matchesSuresh Raina - 5,529 runs in 200 matchesMS Dhoni - 5,269 runs in 268 matchesRohit Sharma, 37, has been in fine form in IPL 2025, having overcome a sluggish start to the season. The veteran batter failed to go past the 30-run mark in his first six matches but has since struck three fifty-plus scores in his last four outings.Rohit produced a well-paced 53 off 36 balls for Mumbai Indians against Rajasthan Royals, adding 116 runs for the opening partnership with Ryan Rickelton, who smashed 61 off just 38 deliveries.Rohit took his time in the initial four overs after Rajasthan won the toss and opted to field. The seasoned campaigner assessed the conditions before switching gears, helping Mumbai Indians plunder 31 runs in the last two overs of their powerplay.Rohit struck nine boundaries, taking on spinners Maheesh Theekshana and Kumar Kartikeya with great effect, sweeping and pulling them to the fence with authority.Rohit's return to form has coincided with Mumbai Indians' resurgence in IPL 2025. MI, who had won only one of their first five matches, have surged into the top four with five consecutive victories.Stay updated onIPL 2025with India Today! Don't miss a moment!- EndsPublished
metadata.title: IPL: Rohit Sharma completes 6,000 runs for MI, joins Virat Kohli in unique list

metadata.content: IPL 2025: Ruthless MI top table, knock Rajasthan Royals out of playoffs raceMumbai Indians (MI) continued their winning run in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) with a 100-run win over Rajasthan Royals (RR) at Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur. The victory extended their winning streak to six matches as they climbed to the top of the points table.Listen to StoryLive TVShareJasprit Bumrah, Hardik Pandya (AP Photo)Rishabh BeniwalNew Delhi,UPDATED:May 1, 2025 23:36 ISTIn ShortMumbai Indians scored 217/2 in 20 overs batting firstRajasthan Royals got bundled out for 117 in 16.1 oversMumbai Indians extended their winning streak to seven matchesMumbai Indians (MI) have made a roaring comeback in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) as they extended their winning streak to six matches with a 100-run victory over Rajasthan Royals (RR). The Hardik Pandya-led side played at its dominating best, crushing Rajasthan on Thursday, May 1, at Sawai Mansingh Stadium, Jaipur, to knock them out of the competition.The victory also helped MI end their 12-year winning drought in Jaipur, with their last victory at the venue coming way back in 2013. A hapless Rajasthan batting line-up could only score 117 in 16.1 overs chasing a massive target of 218, with Jofra Archer top scoring with 30 (27). Following their commanding victory, Mumbai climbed to the top of the points table with seven wins from 11 matches, having 14 points to their name.On the other hand, Rajasthan maintained eighth spot, with three wins from ten matches, having six points. It has been a remarkable comeback for Mumbai, who won just one out of the first five matches.A ruthless bowling displayDefending a massive score, the potent bowling attack of Mumbai was hungry to pounce on Rajasthan. The carnage with the ball began on just the fourth delivery as last game’s heroVaibhav Suryavanshi, got a reality check in life, getting dismissed for a two-ball duckby Deepak Chahar.Suryavanshi’s early departure had little effect on his opening partner Yashasvi Jaiswal, who hit Trent Boult for two maximums. However, it was the left-arm seamer who had the last laugh by dismantling his stumps on 13 (6).IPL 2025: RR vs MI UpdatesWith both openers back in the pavilion, captain Riyan Parag walked to the crease and played a few shots to keep the required run rate in check. However, there was no stopping Trent Boult (3/28), who further got Nitish Rana holed out to deep square leg as the RR batter couldn’t make the most of his drop catch in the previous over.After Rana’s dismissal, Rajasthan were reduced to 41/3 in four overs, but their worst was yet to come as MI skipper unleashed a hungry Jasprit Bumrah (2/15) on them. The speedster immediately made an impact by bouncing out Parag (16 off 8) and Shimron Hetmyer (0 off 10) in his first over itself.As a result, MI became the first team this season to take five wickets inside the powerplay. There was no comeback for RR following a searing new-ball spell as Pandya (1/2) and Karn Sharma (3/23) also joined the party as Rajasthan capitulated against an all-round MI attack.Rohit, Rickelton give solid foundationThe foundation for Mumbai’s win was laid through a 116-run opening stand off 71 balls between Rohit Sharma and Ryan Rickelton, after MI were put in to bat first by RR captain Riyan Parag. The duo was circumspect against the new ball and scored their first boundary on the tenth ball of the innings as Rohit Sharma broke the shackles.At the other end, Ryan Rickelton also got a move on by targeting Fazalhaq Farooqui and Jofra Archer. The duo brought up their fifty-run stand off 32 balls and finished the powerplay on 58/0. Rickelton brought up his half century off 29 balls with a massive six against Kumar Kartikeya.At the other end,Rohit also brought up his third half-century of the season off 31 ballsas the duo registered their maiden century partnership off 61 balls. Rajasthan finally managed to break a massive partnership as Rickelton (61 off 38) and Rohit Sharma (53 off 36) got dismissed in successive overs, falling prey to Maheesh Theekshana (1/47) and Riyan Parag (1/12) respectively.Hardik, Suryakumar's fiery finishLittle did RR know, there was more misery waiting for them as Hardik Pandya and Suryakumar Yadav got together at the crease. Suryakumar made his intentions clear as he got off the mark with a boundary. Pandya also didn’t take much time to get into the groove as he also got off the mark with a cracking four against Farooqui.With a belter of a track to bat on, the duo unleashed their beast mode on RR in no time and didn’t even spare Archer. Suryakumar (48* off 23) put his 360-degree strokeplay on display, sending the ball to all corners of the ground. On the other hand, Pandya (48* off 23) continued to send the ball towards the boundary with his brute force. The duo forged an unbeaten 94-run stand off just 44 balls, giving a strong finish to Mumbai’s innings.Meanwhile, being at the top of their form, MI will next take on the high-flying Gujarat Titans (GT) on May 6 at Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. On the other hand, Rajasthan will look to salvage some pride in their remaining matches as they lock horns with Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) on May 4 at Eden Gardens in Kolkata.Stay updated onIPL 2025with India Today! Getmatch schedules,team squads,live score, and the latestIPL points tableforCSK,MI,RCB,KKR,SRH,LSG,DC,GT,PBKS, andRR. Plus, keep track of the top contenders for the IPLOrange CapandPurple Cap. Don't miss a moment!- EndsPublished
metadata.title: IPL 2025: Ruthless MI top table, knock Rajasthan Royals out of playoffs race
